thread.title: Steelers salary cap: Yearly contract numbers for DL Tyson Alualu
thread.title_full: Steelers salary cap: Yearly contract numbers for DL Tyson Alualu

author: Simon A Chester
title: Steelers salary cap: Yearly contract numbers for DL Tyson Alualu

organizations.name: dl tyson alualu the pittsburgh steelers

text:
The Pittsburgh Steelers latest free-agent signing, defensive lineman Tyson Alualu, turns out to be the most expensive of the offseason so far. Aaron Wilson of the Houston Chronicle is reporting the former Jacksonville Jaguar signed a deal worth $6 million over two years.
Tyson Alualu (Steelers) $6M, $1.75M gtd, $1.25M signing bonus, salaries $1.25M, $3M; $500K April 1 roster bonus
— Aaron Wilson (@AaronWilson_NFL) March 22, 2017 
Alualu will receive a signing bonus of $1.25 million and a roster bonus of $500,000 in his first year. With cap hits of $2.375 million in 2017 and $3.625 million in 2018, the Steelers’ investment in Alualu is not insignificant, especially when compared to the contracts they have handed out to other free agents in the past few weeks.

With this level of commitment to their new addition along the defensive line, it seems even more unlikely Ricardo Mathews will be returning to Pittsburgh. A high draft pick at the position should also be taken off the table.
